results.title: Robert's story [Subtitled]
results.creator_credit: Robert Weston, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
A trip down memory lane for Robert Weston as he reminisces about family, his childhood, fishing and hunting, and living on the land in the bush.
In English language with English subtitles.

results.title: I'm home
results.creator_credit: Ron Briggs, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Identity is the most important thing to Ron Briggs. He talks about his father, his family and the traumatic experiences of being part of the stolen generation which separated him not only from his parents but also from his siblings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ron Briggs, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: From the beginning to the resistances
results.creator_credit: Mick Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Me, my family, my nan - my mob.’ This is Mick Edwards’ story of separation, of a stolen generation or in Edwards’ words, “the kidnapped generation” and of healing and family and reunion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mick Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage
results.brief_description: Undertaken in partnership with Alzheimer’s Australia, Vic Memory’s Voice captures the stories of ten people impacted by dementia. These powerful stories examine the complexities of the condition ‘ the losses, the adjustments and the need to move forward ‘ preserving the spirit of the families involved and creating life long tributes to personal achievement.
results.description: Undertaken in partnership with Alzheimer’s Australia, Vic Memory’s Voice captures the stories of ten people impacted by dementia. These powerful stories examine the complexities of the condition ‘ the losses, the adjustments and the need to move forward ‘ preserving the spirit of the families involved and creating life long tributes to personal achievement.

results.title: Carmel: storyteller
results.brief_description: Carmel is a retired school teacher, wife, mother and grandmother. Her family’ s life dramatically changed when she was diagnosed with early onset memory loss. With her husband, she tells their story and looks positively in the face of an unknown future. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: Moomba belonged to my grandfather
results.brief_description: Moomba belonged to my grandfather, Tom Wittingslow. Of all the shows and carnivals we did all over Australia, Moomba was the best. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Festival.

results.title: Memories of Moomba
results.brief_description: A selection of short films made in a Digital Storytelling workshop held to celebrate 50 years ofthe Moomba festival. The stories explore the history of the parade and life as a sun queen of moomba. It traces the history of the well known carnival family, and highlights the achievements of the key figures involved in the wild and wacky water events. Memories of Moomba was produced in collaboration with City of Melbourne and Melbourne Moomba Waterfest.

results.title: TV news
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Media Probes”.
John Cameron Swayze, US television’s first national anchorman, examines how the drive for ratings has led to some dazzling newsroom packages. Highlights the notion of style in TV news programs and the image of the network for the audience, while touching briefly on the limitations of television as a news medium. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
